intro: Oncostylis ciliata, commonly known as the silky oncostylis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers that are often overlooked due to their size. Oncostylis ciliata is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
